intro: Sarcoca acinosa, commonly known as the purple-flowered sarcoca, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its showy, violet or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, often with a hairy texture. Sarcoca acinosa is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
